Resort Guidelines
Frequently Asked Questions
Resort Map
Resort Guidelines
Frequently Asked Questions
Resort Map
Paradise Awaits at Pensacola RV Resort
We are thrilled that you are considering us for your next adventure! Whether you have a question, are looking to book your stay, or simply want to say hello, we’d love to hear from you. Our dedicated team is just a call away, ready to assist you with your stay. We look forward to connecting with you and ensuring that your time at Pensacola RV Resort is truly memorable. Your adventure awaits – let’s make it extraordinary together.
DISCOVER PARADISE
Set up camp right on the beach, enjoy beachside amenities, and connect with fellow travelers. Secure your spot for an unforgettable coastal getaway!

Resort Map
About Us
Mission and Core Values
We provide a pristine RV Resort experience with exceptional customer service geared toward creating lasting memories for our guests.
Togetherness:
We are united by our passion to create lasting memories for our guests.
Dependability:
We go beyond the expected to provide unparalleled hospitality.
Integrity:
We are honest, committed, and determined to do what is best for our guests and our company.
Fun:
We try not to take ourselves to seriously, we make fun happen!
Our Story
Dive into the fascinating tale of Pensacola Beach RV Resort’s evolution, discovering the twists and turns that shaped our current identity and location.
Unearth the stories, achievements, and heartfelt efforts that have contributed to our resort’s history, crafting the distinctive destination we are today.
========= Timeline Widget  Addon For Elementor 1.6.8 =========
Start of Story Repeater Content
Story Label
1952
Story Icon
Story Arrow
Start of Story Content
Story Image
Story Title
Purchasing and Building
Story Description
Two investment groups got together and purchased the Holiday Homes on the Gulf, the Holiday Townhouses on the Sound and then used the adjacent properties to build Shea’s Tiki House Motel and Lounge. For the purposes of our story, we shall call one investment group the ‘Fun Guys’ and the other investment group the ‘Mean Guys.’ Both developments were built in 1952 and designed around the idea of families having the perfect vacation all together. Unfortunately, Holiday Homes on the Gulf of Mexico was eventually destroyed by a Hurricane.
Start of Story Repeater Content
Story Label
1973
Story Icon
Story Arrow
Start of Story Content
Story Image
Story Title
Franchised
Story Description
After the destruction of Holiday Homes the investment group decided to build the first franchised hotel on Pensacola Beach. In 1973 the Howard Johnson was born with 100 rooms, the Orange Roof Restaurant, and the Rum Keg Lounge.
Start of Story Repeater Content
Story Label
Late 1970s
Story Icon
Story Arrow
Start of Story Content
Story Image
Story Title
Shea's Tiki Motel
Story Description
Shea’s Tiki House Motel became the place to be on Pensacola Beach. The Gulf side had a total of 45 rooms, a pool, and the famous Tiki Lounge. The Tiki Lounge was located underneath the rooms on the Gulf side (see picture) with the Gulf waters just steps away. On the Sound side the Tiki House had 24 units and a pool.
Start of Story Repeater Content
Story Label
March 30
Story Icon
Story Arrow
Start of Story Content
Story Image
Story Title
Change of Management
Story Description
As time went on the ‘Mean Guys’ investment group decided that they were better equipped to run these developments. The ‘Fun Guys’ investment group decided to let the ‘Mean Guys’ buy them out of all of the projects except the Holiday Townhouses which the ‘Mean Guys’ believed was a waste of money. So the two investment groups went their separate ways. But of course the story can’t stop here…
Start of Story Repeater Content
Story Label
March 30
Story Icon
Story Arrow
Start of Story Content
Story Image
Story Title
The Buy Back
Story Description
Within three years time the ‘Mean Guys’ investment group went bankrupt and all three of their properties: Howard Johnson, Tiki House on the Gulf, and the Tiki House on the Sound, went up for foreclosure. Since the ‘Fun Guys’ investment group already owned the property next door they decided to buy back the Tiki House on the Sound. Now they owned almost 7 acres of land with about 600 feet of water on the Sound side.
Start of Story Repeater Content
Story Label
March 30
Story Icon
Story Arrow
Start of Story Content
Story Image
Story Title
Business is Booming
Story Description
The ‘Fun Guys’ investment group was now running the Holiday Townhouses and the Tiki House on the Sound. The Holiday Townhouses had five buildings with a total of 20 units. The Tiki House Motel had a total of 24 units. These 44 units were run with success by a staff of two desk clerks, one maintenance man, and one maid.
The maintenance man, Charles, was one of the most vivacious and dedicated people you would ever know. His career started with the Tiki House and ran all the way though to the RV Resorts. He was an amazing human being and we will remember him always.
Start of Story Repeater Content
Story Label
March 30
Story Icon
Story Arrow
Start of Story Content
Story Image
Story Title
Disaster Strikes
Story Description
In typical Florida fashion, a few Hurricanes came through. All of the Holiday Townhouses were destroyed but one which still stands today in between sites 31 and sites 32. The entire 24 units of the Tiki House Motel was also demolished by mother nature. The property sat empty except during the Blue Angels Air Shows when the ‘Fun Guys’ investment group would rent out parking spots.
Start of Story Repeater Content
Story Label
2008
Story Icon
Story Arrow
Start of Story Content
Story Image
Story Title
The Idea Begins
Story Description
In about 2008 the ‘Fun Guys’ investment group got their first tax bill for the 6.9 acres of land on Pensacola Beach. Prior to this lease-hold property was not subject to property tax. Needless to say it was a large bill for a vacant lot, this pushed the group into action. They needed to develop the land into something new and exciting that the community was in need of, something Pensacola Beach didn’t have. Pensacola Beach RV Resort was born!
Start of Story Repeater Content
Story Label
September 20, 2012
Story Icon
Story Arrow
Start of Story Content
Story Image
Story Title
Pensacola Beach RV Resort Opens
Story Description
Pensacola Beach RV Resort opened September 20, 2012, just before De Luna Fest. It was a crazy weekend to open and we had a packed house for the event weekend. Since then we have learned a lot, made some mistakes, made lots of improvements and most of all enjoyed being a part of creating memories for our guests. Everyone involved in the creation and development of our RV Resort would like to sincerely thank our RV guests from the bottom of our hearts. You guys make everything we do worth it, we could not ask to be a part of a better community.
Add Arrows
Testimonials
Beach Vacay
- This was our 8th yearly trip. It was amazing as always, makes it hard to leave! Great location and facilities. You can walk to many shops, bars, and restaurants. There’s
... read more
even a tiki bar in your backyard. Can’t wait until next year!!!
Cynthia W
May 25, 2023
Great experience
- My husband & I had booked a spot for a RV. Due to the transmission going out, we had to book a room. Thank God the Tiki Room was available.
... read more
Because of this, we didn’t have to cancel our vacation. Everyone was nice & friendly. The place was very inviting. We will be returning.
brenda g
August 14, 2023
This file should primarily consist of HTML with a little bit of PHP.

About Us
Mission and Core Values
We provide a pristine RV Resort experience with exceptional customer service geared toward creating lasting memories for our guests.
Togetherness:
We are united by our passion to create lasting memories for our guests.
Dependability:
We go beyond the expected to provide unparalleled hospitality.
Integrity:
We are honest, committed, and determined to do what is best for our guests and our company.
Fun:
We try not to take ourselves to seriously, we make fun happen!
Our Story
Dive into the fascinating tale of Pensacola Beach RV Resort’s evolution, discovering the twists and turns that shaped our current identity and location.
Unearth the stories, achievements, and heartfelt efforts that have contributed to our resort’s history, crafting the distinctive destination we are today.
========= Timeline Widget  Addon For Elementor 1.6.8 =========
Start of Story Repeater Content
Story Label
1952
Story Icon
Story Arrow
Start of Story Content
Story Image
Story Title
Purchasing and Building
Story Description
Two investment groups got together and purchased the Holiday Homes on the Gulf, the Holiday Townhouses on the Sound and then used the adjacent properties to build Shea’s Tiki House Motel and Lounge. For the purposes of our story, we shall call one investment group the ‘Fun Guys’ and the other investment group the ‘Mean Guys.’ Both developments were built in 1952 and designed around the idea of families having the perfect vacation all together. Unfortunately, Holiday Homes on the Gulf of Mexico was eventually destroyed by a Hurricane.
Start of Story Repeater Content
Story Label
1973
Story Icon
Story Arrow
Start of Story Content
Story Image
Story Title
Franchised
Story Description
After the destruction of Holiday Homes the investment group decided to build the first franchised hotel on Pensacola Beach. In 1973 the Howard Johnson was born with 100 rooms, the Orange Roof Restaurant, and the Rum Keg Lounge.
Start of Story Repeater Content
Story Label
Late 1970s
Story Icon
Story Arrow
Start of Story Content
Story Image
Story Title
Shea's Tiki Motel
Story Description
Shea’s Tiki House Motel became the place to be on Pensacola Beach. The Gulf side had a total of 45 rooms, a pool, and the famous Tiki Lounge. The Tiki Lounge was located underneath the rooms on the Gulf side (see picture) with the Gulf waters just steps away. On the Sound side the Tiki House had 24 units and a pool.
Start of Story Repeater Content
Story Label
March 30
Story Icon
Story Arrow
Start of Story Content
Story Image
Story Title
Change of Management
Story Description
As time went on the ‘Mean Guys’ investment group decided that they were better equipped to run these developments. The ‘Fun Guys’ investment group decided to let the ‘Mean Guys’ buy them out of all of the projects except the Holiday Townhouses which the ‘Mean Guys’ believed was a waste of money. So the two investment groups went their separate ways. But of course the story can’t stop here…
Start of Story Repeater Content
Story Label
March 30
Story Icon
Story Arrow
Start of Story Content
Story Image
Story Title
The Buy Back
Story Description
Within three years time the ‘Mean Guys’ investment group went bankrupt and all three of their properties: Howard Johnson, Tiki House on the Gulf, and the Tiki House on the Sound, went up for foreclosure. Since the ‘Fun Guys’ investment group already owned the property next door they decided to buy back the Tiki House on the Sound. Now they owned almost 7 acres of land with about 600 feet of water on the Sound side.
Start of Story Repeater Content
Story Label
March 30
Story Icon
Story Arrow
Start of Story Content
Story Image
Story Title
Business is Booming
Story Description
The ‘Fun Guys’ investment group was now running the Holiday Townhouses and the Tiki House on the Sound. The Holiday Townhouses had five buildings with a total of 20 units. The Tiki House Motel had a total of 24 units. These 44 units were run with success by a staff of two desk clerks, one maintenance man, and one maid.
The maintenance man, Charles, was one of the most vivacious and dedicated people you would ever know. His career started with the Tiki House and ran all the way though to the RV Resorts. He was an amazing human being and we will remember him always.
Start of Story Repeater Content
Story Label
March 30
Story Icon
Story Arrow
Start of Story Content
Story Image
Story Title
Disaster Strikes
Story Description
In typical Florida fashion, a few Hurricanes came through. All of the Holiday Townhouses were destroyed but one which still stands today in between sites 31 and sites 32. The entire 24 units of the Tiki House Motel was also demolished by mother nature. The property sat empty except during the Blue Angels Air Shows when the ‘Fun Guys’ investment group would rent out parking spots.
Start of Story Repeater Content
Story Label
2008
Story Icon
Story Arrow
Start of Story Content
Story Image
Story Title
The Idea Begins
Story Description
In about 2008 the ‘Fun Guys’ investment group got their first tax bill for the 6.9 acres of land on Pensacola Beach. Prior to this lease-hold property was not subject to property tax. Needless to say it was a large bill for a vacant lot, this pushed the group into action. They needed to develop the land into something new and exciting that the community was in need of, something Pensacola Beach didn’t have. Pensacola Beach RV Resort was born!
Start of Story Repeater Content
Story Label
September 20, 2012
Story Icon
Story Arrow
Start of Story Content
Story Image
Story Title
Pensacola Beach RV Resort Opens
Story Description
Pensacola Beach RV Resort opened September 20, 2012, just before De Luna Fest. It was a crazy weekend to open and we had a packed house for the event weekend. Since then we have learned a lot, made some mistakes, made lots of improvements and most of all enjoyed being a part of creating memories for our guests. Everyone involved in the creation and development of our RV Resort would like to sincerely thank our RV guests from the bottom of our hearts. You guys make everything we do worth it, we could not ask to be a part of a better community.
Add Arrows
Testimonials
Great Weekend Watching the Blue Angels!
- Our family had a wonderful time camping at Pensacola Beach RV Resort for the Blue Angels air show weekend! The campground is located on the north side of the road,
... read more
so all you have to do is walk across the street and down a long wooden walkway to get to the beach. There is a small beach area connected to the north side of the campground that faces the sound where kids can play. Also on that side is the Sneaky Tiki bar if you need something cool and refreshing. The bath/shower rooms are nice and the ladies working at the front desk were wonderful! I look forward to going back again soon.
webejeepin
July 10, 2023
RV stay on our tour of the southern states of the USA
- This was our last but one stop on our RV holiday and to say we saved the best until last, is a bit of an understatement. Booking in was easy
... read more
as was plugging in to the site and the resort was gorgeous. The Sneaky Tikki bar was superb as were the cocktails ?. The beach area was beautifully laid out giving us the opportunity to sit back and relax and look at the dolphins in the North Atlanta. It was a pity we were only there 1 night, so coming back for more is definitely an option ??
Roam15950642581
May 28, 2023

Resort Map
Paradise Awaits at Pensacola RV Resort
We are thrilled that you are considering us for your next adventure! Whether you have a question, are looking to book your stay, or simply want to say hello, we’d love to hear from you. Our dedicated team is just a call away, ready to assist you with your stay. We look forward to connecting with you and ensuring that your time at Pensacola RV Resort is truly memorable. Your adventure awaits – let’s make it extraordinary together.

Our dedicated team is just a call away, ready to assist you with your stay. We look forward to connecting with you and ensuring that your time at Pensacola RV Resort is truly memorable. Your adventure awaits – let’s make it extraordinary together.
